intro: Athenaea purpusii, commonly known as the Purpus's athenaea, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in arid environments and is adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation and evolution. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
